conclusion: Analyze forces on the copper rod MN when energized in a magnetic field.
The rod MN is suspended horizontally in a magnetic field directed into the paper.
Identify forces: weight (mg) downward, tension (T) upward, magnetic force (FB) horizontally.
When not energized, tension in each wire is half the rod's weight: T0 = mg/2.
When energized, tension is 1/4 of original: T = mg/8.
Substitute T = mg/8 into equilibrium equation: FB = 3mg/4.
Magnetic force on a conductor: FB = ILB.
Use right-hand rule to determine current direction.
Direction of current is from M to N.
Final answer: Magnitude of current is 3mg/4LB, direction is from M to N.
